name: Louise Barkhuus
content: Louise Barkhuus | Home Louise Barkhuus Researcher at New York University and Professor at the IT University of Copenhagen louise.barkhuus [AT] nyu.edu Bio I am currently a researcher at New York University, and a professor at The IT University of Copenhagen. I have been at ITU since 2016; before that I was a visiting professor at Cornell Tech for two years. I was an Associate Professor at Stockholm University from 2012-2015 and a research scientist at UC San Diego from 2007 to 2011. Research My research focuses on human-centered AI, particularly relating to privacy perceptions in AI facilitated socio-technical systems. I use qualitative and mixed methods to study human interaction and practices around AI technologies, in particular location-based technologies, in order to provide a better understanding of how to design privacy sensitive social AI technologies. Publications For a more comprehensive list of publications, see Google Scholar. In November 2025, I started at a researcher at NYU, in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering (more info). June 2025. I am sub-committee chair for CHI 2026, Understanding Users, Qualitative Research (more info). July 2024. I am part of the editorial team for CSCW 2025 (more info). August 2023. From September 2023 to June 2025 I was a visiting professor at Rutgers University, in the Department of Library and Information Science (more info). September 2022. From September 2022 I was a Fulbright Scholar at Columbia University in the Department of Biomedical Informatics, working with Lena Mamykina (more info). July 1st 2021. I became a full Professor at the IT University of Copenhagen (more info). Personal I live in New York City with my two children.
